data.title: The Ultimate List of Sample Breakdowns by Tracklib: The Best Chops & Flips Of All Time
data.meta_description: Discover the best sample breakdowns in music history on Tracklib. Explore iconic sampling techniques behind legendary songs. From hip-hop classics to modern hits.
data.text: Tracklib's Sample Breakdown celebrates the art of sampling. The series visualizes the sampling techniques behind the songs. From iconic golden-era hip-hop samples to today's biggest hits. By Tracklib · July 23, 2024 Tip: Looking for breakdowns of your favorite producer, artist, or song? Hit Control+F / Command+F and start exploring. Jump to Section / Genre - MADE WITH TRACKLIB - FULL ALBUM BREAKDOWNS - SAMPLE BREAKDOWNS: EXTENDED - HIP-HOP Boom Bap Lofi Hip-Hop Trap, Drill & Grime - ELECTRONIC MUSIC - POP Made With Tracklib From Kendrick Lamar to Kaytranada: a who's who of artists used Tracklib as an integral part of the production process to dig, flip, and license samples. Below you find an overview of hits made with Tracklib. SAMPLED AND CLEARED THROUGH TRACKLIB Produced by: Machinedrum Samples: Nathan Murphy Singers - He'll Understand (1982) Fabio Borgazzi Fabor - Ma Griffe (1982) The Good Samaritans - Ughamwen-Rhienenemwen (1982) SAMPLED AND CLEARED THROUGH TRACKLIB Produced by: Ye, Ty Dolla $ign, The Legendary Traxster, Leon Thomas Sample: Band of Thieves - Love Me Or Leave Me (1976) SAMPLED AND CLEARED THROUGH TRACKLIB Produced by: MashBeatz Sample: James Monroe - Frontiersman of the Galaxy (1977) SAMPLED AND CLEARED THROUGH TRACKLIB Produced by: Jansport J, Hit-Boy Sample: Keys - Lovin Cup SAMPLED AND CLEARED THROUGH TRACKLIB Produced by: Sounwave, DJ Dahi, Bekon, Beach Noise, Duval Timothy, Victor Ekpo Sample: Hoskins 'Ncrowd - You're Not There SAMPLED AND CLEARED THROUGH TRACKLIB Produced by: T-MINUS & J. Cole Sample: First Choice - Wake Up To Me (Take 1) (1973) Full Album Breakdowns Time to get deep. These Sample Breadowns uncover nearly ALL of the samples on Daft Punk's Discovery, Kanye West's Graduation, and Kendrick Lamar's good kid, m.A.A.d city. Kanye West's My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy The Samples Behind the Beefs Daft Punk's Discovery Kanye West's Graduation Kendrick Lamar's good kid, m.A.A.d city Sample Breakdowns: Extended In tutorial-style videos, the Sample Breakdown Extended series explains which sampling techniques were used for some of the biggest hits and hip-hop classics. The Most Iconic Hip-Hop Sample of Every Year (1973-2023) The Eighth Note Technique J Dilla Used for 'Donuts' How Havoc Created Iconic Beats like "Shook Ones Pt. II" The Simple Trick that Made Daft Punk's "One More Time" an Infectious Hit Sample Breakdowns: Hip-Hop The art of sampling is deeply ingrained in hip-hop music. This overview takes you through old-school classics and new-school hits. You can also jump straight to the subcategories Boom Bap, Lofi Hip-Hop, or Trap, Drill & Grime. 50 Years of Hip-Hop Sampling: The Most Iconic Sample of Every Year (1973-2023) Produced by: DJ Mustard Sample: King Willonius - BBL Drizzy (2024) Produced by: Metro Boomin Samples: Monk Higgins, YG, The Sixth Sense Produced by: Boi-1da, Tay Keith, Mark Ronson, Fierce, Kevin Mitchell, Dramakid, Preme & Jordan Fox Samples: The Grodeck Whipperjenny, Public Enemy, and interpolations of Kendrick Lamar & Drake Produced by: Sounwave & Jack Antonoff Sample: Al Green - What a Wonderful Thing Love Is (1972) Produced by: Sounwave, Cardo, Kyro, Johnny Juliano & Yung Exclusive Samples: Teddy Pendergrass, Richard Pryor in The Wiz Produced by: Kanye West, Ojivolta & Earl on the Beat Sample: Yeo - Jacob's Ladder (2012) Produced by: Metro Boomin Samples: Rodney O & Joe Cooley - Everlasting Bass (1988) Eazy-E - Eazy-Duz-It (1988) Produced by: Conductor Williams Sample: The Winans & Anita Baker - Ain't No Need to Worry (1987) Produced by: Conductor Williams Sample: Jimmy Q - Maze (2023) Produced by: Juicy J, DJ Paul Sample: Willie Hutch - I Choose You (1973) Produced by: Kanye West Sample: Otis Redding - Try A Little Tenderness (1966) Produced by: Boi-1da Sample: Hamilton, Joe Frank & Reynolds - Fallin' In Love (1975) Produced by: Warren G Samples: Bob James, Michael McDonald Produced by: DJ Dahi, Sounwave, Terrace Martin, Anthony 'Top Dawg' Tiffith Sample: Bruno Mars - 24K Magic (2016) Produced by: OutKast Sample: The Chambers Brothers - So Tired (1967) Produced by: A$AP Ty Beats Sample: The S.O.S.
